you
[Music]
hi and welcome you're listening to the
x22 report my name is Dave and this is
episode 1326 a and today's date is July
7th 2017 and the title of the episode is
massive inflection point headed our way
will this lead to a crash this fall
let's get into the economic collapse
financial news now we've been seeing
strange things happen in the market
especially with gold and silver where
all of a sudden someone sells you know
thousands upon thousands of contracts
brings down the gold price and the
silver price and we know that this is
complete manipulation we also seen on
the stock market where Amazon all of a
sudden just dropped out of nowhere now
they're saying these are all glitches
and just last night we had a silver
flash crash now this is being reported
as a glitch and this implies there was
no person or fat-finger banker spoofing
the market it just was a computer error
and all of a sudden 8200 contracts were
dumped into the market in five minutes
and silver drops 6% before all of a
sudden snapping back so the question is
because we know that these markets are
manipulated we know that they use these
systems we know that the Fed has a
trading desk we know they have a
computer system where they can make the
market go up they can make the market go
down they can make the market do
whatever they want and the question is
are these really glitches or were they
planning on doing something and then all
of a sudden change their mind because
these are becoming more and more
frequent and we can see at this point
that a lot of this doesn't even make
sense actually the market doesn't even
make sense because things are not adding
up because look what's happening in the
retail market look what's happening with
corporate tax revenue so for the market
to continually move up and up and up
something does not make sense plus we
know central banks and other countries
around the world they've been buying a
lot
of tech stocks they've been basically
keeping the market up there in the tech
sector so we know that unemployment's
manipulated we know the markets
manipulated we know GDPs
manipulated everything that we've been
looking at is completely manipulated and
people say why do you know this is
manipulated are you just saying it's
manipulated because when you put all the
pieces together it doesn't make sense in
what they're reporting let's look at the
new Beale BLS report that they put out
they said they added two hundred and
twenty two thousand jobs now the BLS
reported that 31,000 employees they
couldn't work due to poor weather
conditions which is roughly in line with
the 35,000 average for June and yet some
221 thousand workers who usually work
full-time could only work part-time due
to the weather last month really in
maybe the weather was that bad all right
that doesn't make sense at all and then
we look at this and we say okay where
are all these jobs coming from now we
know that retail they're closing stores
we know a lot of people being laid off
we know that the food industry well the
restaurant Performance Index is dropping
traffic is drying up and this is where
all the workers are basically moving
into now we know that the corporate jobs
they are still laying off so they're
continually telling us overtime that
we're adding retail jobs we're adding
the foodservice jobs we're adding health
jobs and when you look at this this is
just all part-time stuff we haven't
really added manufacturing or real good
full-time jobs where they're telling us
all these jobs are being added or
basically in the part-time world so the
question is how did the June payroll
surprise so strongly to the upside
because we know that ADP well it looks
like they were dropping in the amount of
jobs that were being added in the
private sector well it was because of
local government
they hired 35,000 jobs in June and
they're saying that the food service
industry and drink places well they
added 29,000 jobs and we have the health
sector we had education and when we look
at this we can see that these are all
part-time type of work some of the
government jobs they were full-time but
then they also said that the retail
sector added 8,000 people really with
all these stores shutting down with
these stores declaring bankruptcy
they're adding employees to the retail
sector even if they added 8,000 how many
were lost
what 8,000 added to Amazon let's say and
what 75,000 lost in the brick-and-mortar
business that's not a plus to the
economy that's a loss of jobs and we can
see that these numbers are moving in the
opposite direction of reality because
they're not even making sense anymore
because when you see three thousand five
thousand eight thousand stores closed
you know that these jobs are completely
lost
where are they going to get jobs we're
at another retail manufacturer or
another retail store I should say no
because too many of them are closing
right now so we could see that these
numbers really don't make sense
whatsoever and as we move forward into
this year well we're going to have the
manipulated numbers the BLS the GDP
retail sales housing sales and all these
other things they're going to be heading
in one direction into manipulation world
and the reality is going to be going in
the opposite direction and they're going
to be separating which we've been seeing
for a very long time
which tells us that these manipulated
numbers they're really not making any
sense at all now let's think about this
for a second we have retail businesses
that are closing down people are losing
their jobs
there's more and more real estate that's
going to be basically empty out in strip
malls in malls and a lot of these strip
malls and moles
they're going to be going bankrupt a lot
of these retail stores are going
bankrupt a lot of small businesses are
going bankrupt this is not because of
online it's because people aren't making
the same funds like they used to because
they're getting laid off and they only
can maybe find part-time jobs or they
can't find jobs at all so they're not
making the same salary as they were now
we're seeing commercial chapter 11
bankruptcy z' well they're on the rise
they've jumped 16 percent year-over-year
in June to 581 filings across the u.s.
and these are all types large
corporations tiny sole proprietorships
and we can see that coming from the
american bankruptcy institute we're
seeing that there are more and more
filings that are occurring right now now
the next wave of these bankruptcies well
it is building right now and large and
small retail operations while they're at
the forefront and we need to remember
something very important that when we
see all of these stores closed these are
the big chain stores we also have to
remember there are many mom-and-pop type
of stores fashion shops and things like
that that are closing so we have those
piled on top of the chain stores which
we can see we're having a complete
brick-and-mortar meltdown right now and
again as we move forward we're going to
see a lot more of this we also see
consumer bankruptcies they are rising
right now now the primary cause for the
increase in filings are the 1.1 2
trillion in auto loans the trillion
dollars in credit card debt and other
consumer loans people well they spent
the money and now the bill is coming due
and they don't have the funds to
make these payments either they lost
their job or they lost their job and
they got a part-time job and making ends
meet becomes very very difficult so
we're starting to see a lot of consumer
bankruptcies now on the rise the same
with commercial bankruptcies I mean
we're heading into an area where it's
going to be completely one gigantic
disaster now an analyst and Bank of
America this analyst has written that
over the next six months higher interest
rates will likely be much more negative
for stocks and credit yes credit given
new Central Bank policies now we can see
that we're at the end of this credit
cycle and we can see that the central
bank is raising the interest rates we
can see that they're going to try to
unwind their balance sheet and what this
analyst is saying is that by the Fed
tightening and by the ECB saying that
they're going to be tightening well the
bond yield they're going to be rising
and the volatility is going to be
reducing the tech stocks now the Bank of
America analyst says when looking at
near-term catalysts he views the summer
this summer of 2017 as a massive
inflection point in central bank
liquidity trade as this all happens this
analyst is saying that we will likely
lead to a big fall in the market most
likely during the autumn time period and
what they're saying is they're looking
at going all the way back in the past of
when the Fed was tightening and when
things started to turn downward and they
pinpointed when the Fed reaches the
interest rates around 2% or so very
close to 2% this is when the market is
going to start to fall apart and he's
expecting the Fed to raise the rates
once again and maybe twice before the
fall which will bring us
to that point in time of where we're
very close to that 2% and what we're
seeing right now if we go back in time
we can see that this has happened pretty
much almost every single time going all
the way back to the to the Great
Depression of 1929
every time the Fed Titan where they were
raising rates the market crashed now the
last time we saw this was back in O 7
where they were raising the interest
rates in 2005-2006 they got it up to a
certain point which was around 5% and
then all of a sudden things started to
completely fall apart and the entire
system fell apart well we are very close
to that period of where we're going to
see the market fall apart and if it does
hit this point we will start to see
everything come apart and the entire
system will start to fall now I believe
that they're going to do this in two
parts yes the market might fall during
the autumn time period but the Fed which
they want to do they want to step in and
they want to push stimulus and they want
to lower the rates at this point because
they know they can't raise the rates and
they're going to lower the rates maybe
even go in the negative territory and
they're going to ramp up stimulus and
they're going to say that they have
saved the economy and they're going to
continue to pump in as much stimulus and
they're going to drop the rates
dramatically during this period of time
and of course the corporate media
they're all going to say look what the
Fed did they save the economy and once
the economy is pumped up a little bit
where they say okay it's recovering now
even though it really isn't it's only
the stock market everything else is
going to be falling apart like crazy all
of a sudden we're going to get hit with
some type of an event which they'll
blame this on maybe Trump maybe they'll
blame this on a cyber attack because a
cyber attack will be very easy for them
to use to say listen
yes it was a cyberattack on the
financial institutions we had to close
the bank and they really have to show no
proof because we can see in the past
with everything that had been done with
the Russian hacking the BNC attacks with
the Sony attack from North Korea which
really never happened they really didn't
have to show any proof they just have to
come out in the corporate media and tell
you that this is happening and most
likely this is what they're going to do
during this time period so we're
probably going to see something if this
analyst is correct and we know there's a
lot of other people like David Stockman
Charles nanner Harry dent and many
others that are saying that yes during
this time period it looks like we might
have a major problem now if they boost
it up we might see the market come down
once again probably in the spring time
period of 2018 and of course they're
going to blame this on something else so
they'll pump it up for the next couple
of months and then all of a sudden the
whole thing will come apart and they'll
have to close the banking system they'll
have to use baylin's and the fun starts
this is when the real collapse happens
so we're watching this very carefully
we're listening to what all these
individuals are saying we're looking at
all the indicators putting them together
and again this is not something that you
can just pinpoint and say yes it's going
to happen at this point in time but with
all the indicators and you add them all
up and you go back in history and you
put everything together you can get a
general idea of when this is going to
happen and we have never seen except two
the lead-up of 2008 an economy fall
apart like this before I mean yes if you
go back to the other recession points in
time even if you go back to the Great
Depression you can see leading up to
that point things were breaking down
dramatically in the real economy I'm not
talking about the stock market the same
thing is happening here right now in the
real economy things are breaking down
rapidly and they're very noticeable if
you're looking if you're not looking and
you're listening to the corporate media
you think everything is okay you're
listening to the Fed you think things
are fantastic and again with Yellen who
says we're not going to see another
crisis in our lifetime to me that's the
signal they just let you know
that yet it is coming right now so get
prepared get ready because this is going
to be a very interesting summer and fall
listen everyone thanks a lot for
listening be well be safe and especially
be prepared thanks a lot
